children.value: This article briefly introduces the principles of Hyrax-PCS, whose security assumption is Discrete Log. Its main idea is to prove an Inner Product and adopts the recursive folding approach to gradually fold two vectors of length

children.html: nnn
n/2n/2n/2

children.value: , reducing the inner product calculation to the inner product calculation of vectors with only half the length. The recursive folding idea mainly comes from [BCC+16] and [BBB+18], with the main problem being that the Verifier’s computational complexity is

children.html: O(n)O(n)O(n)

children.value: . To make Hyrax meet the requirements of zkSNARK, Hyrax rearranges the vector into a

children.html: n×n\sqrt{n}\times\sqrt{n}n​×n​

children.value: matrix, then reduces the inner product calculation to the inner product calculation of vectors with length

children.html: n\sqrt{n}n​

children.value: . This results in the Verifier’s computational complexity being optimized to

children.html: O(n)O(\sqrt{n})O(n​)

children.value: . At the same time, after optimization by [BCC+16], Hyrax’s Proof size (communication complexity) is also optimized to

children.html: O(log⁡n)O(\log{n})O(logn)
